item.title: World Tree
item.description:
A world tree planted by Fomori within the blind eternities, between the Edge and the Multiverse, each seeded with life and since left to their own devices.
Insectile sapients and Humans had been taken from the Exoverse, while other insectile sapients and Humans had been taken from the Multiverse. They were each placed onto the fruits, the many realms of the world tree, along with simple plant life, a curation vault to ensure a smooth transition, and, of all things, Slivers.Each realm is aligned with a single color identity, the branches and roots of the cosmic tree, encasing them, draining them of certain colors of mana, and injecting them with other colors of mana.
The Slivers were not brought in without purpose, they are integeral to the lifecycle of this tree itself, growing to a certain point, nebulously greater than the prior point, where then the hive slaughters their members, gives all of the Manastones they have amassed, and even temporarily kill their territory, causing a wave of incredible and arguably near infinite quantities of mana into the tree. This causes the tree to gain a growth spurt, the expansion of the realms, the expansion of the tree.These events causes a sound of the air itself tearing apart, earthquakes to rock the entirety of each realm. The lands multiply, the atmosphere fills in empty space as it is refilled. Despite the cataclysmic process of realmatic expansion, deaths caused by them are rare, injuries not so much, temporary hearing loss not being particularly uncommon.These events, due to the sound and the sudden lack of Skep activity, are called Crashes. As of now, there have been eighteen such events, causing the differences in realm sizes between strata to become readily apparent.The World Tree holds thirty two realms, one for each color identity. These realms are separated by strata within the canopies of the world tree.The roots of this great cosmic tree are grown around a single realm, these roots sap out the colors of mana, forcing the realm to be colorless.
Komas - A realm devoid of colors of mana, unique for its mechanical Slivers. The first strata of the world tree's canopy grasps the realms who's identities possess only a single color of mana.

item.title: Slivers
item.description:
Slivers have three methods of reproduction, one from the multiverse, one from the exoverse, and one unique to this plane.The first, unique to this plane, is autogenesis. The liquid metal pool in the heart of every hive periodically spawns thrum. The number spawned has increased over the course of the crashes, initially having been one at midnight and one at midday. At this point, one spawns roughly every three hours and twelve minutes. The second, the multiversal method, is parthenogenesis. Slivers are capable of laying eggs via asexual reproduction. This can only be done while the individual's cortisol levels are low to non-existent, otherwise known as the individual feeling safe and secure. There are, of course, exceptions or modifications to this if the hiveform is specialized for reproduction in some capacity. Three notable examples being Sliver Queen, The First Sliver, and Hatchery Sliver. The queen can simply do this regardless of state and hatchery overdrives this process.
The third, the exoversal method, is oviparity. Specifically, utilizing externally fertilized parasitic ovipositors. Basically, xenomorphing people. Stabbing them with a specific tendrils that can extend from their beak-like 'faces' and implanting an embryo. It uses the genetics of the host to determine the color alignment and future adaptation (if any), technically the external fertilization is this process of utilizing the host's dna. If you are, at the time of being implanted, classified as a blue black being, then the sliver who emerges would either be colorless or blue black. The host will be unconscious for a day, due to adjacently injected toxins that quells the immune system and causes the host to believe they simply fell asleep rather than having been injected with an embryo, then it will develop over the course of ten days in the host, then spend five days after violently bursting from the host's torso to mature fully into a Thrum or fully adapted Sliver.

item.title: Nantuko
item.description: Insectile sapients imported into the world tree from the Multiverse, they are considered to be insatiable and have an innate capacity for magic.

item.title: Eumidians
item.description: Insectile sapients imported into the world tree from the Edge, they have since changed into more humanoid appearances to aide with diplomacy of the humans. Their origin from the edge has granted them an innate talent with technology, and on many of the realms they are found, they are the most technologically advanced society on the realm.

item.title: Humans
item.description: Diverse and 'malleable', their genetics are capable of being affected by their environment.They have no particular knack for technology or sorcery, unlike the Eumidians or the Nantuko, respectively.Though, due to their malleability, there are those who have the capacity to integrate technologies or arcane capacities into themselves.
